data.title: A2CAF: Small + Indie Press 2024
data.text:
A2CAF: Small + Indie Press will take place on October 5, 2024.

Ann Arbor Comic Arts Festival (A2CAF): Small + Indie Press is a one-day venture into the world of small press comics publishing. This event offers attendees the chance to meet comic artists and learn about the art of creating comics outside of a traditional publisher. Due to the content of many independently published books, this event is intended for a teen and adult audience. A2CAF: Small + Indie Press is created in partnership with Athenaeum Comic Art.

Our friends at Vault of Midnight will be at A2CAF Small + Indie Press selling books by all our headliners for signings.

Want to keep up with A2CAF: Small + Indie Press? Join our mailing list.

Vendor Applications are NOW CLOSED. Stay tuned to find out which artists will be participating!

Announcing the 2024 A2CAF: Small + Indie Press headliners!

Trung Le Nguyen

Trung Le Nguyen is an award-winning Vietnamese-American cartoonist, artist, and writer best known as the author of the graphic novel The Magic Fish. He has contributed work for various comic publishers, including DC Comics, Oni Press, Boom! Studios, Image Comics, and Marvel.

Ebony Flowers

Ebony Flowers is an accomplished writer, cartoonist, and recipient of the 2017 Rona Jaffe Award to identify and support women writers of exceptional promise. Flowers' debut graphic novel Hot Comb contains a mix of autobiographical and fictional short story comics. She has been published in The Paris Review, The New York Times, and The New Yorker.

Tillie Walden

Tillie Walden is a cartoonist and illustrator, best known for her emotional storytelling and dream-like comics, who, at age 21, had already published five graphic novels and a webcomic. Her graphic novel memoir Spinning won the 2018 Eisner Award for Best Reality-Based Work, making Walden one of the youngest Eisner Award winners ever. Her latest work, Tegan and Sara: Crush, will be published in October 2024.

2024 Schedule of Events

11:30 AM - 12:30 PM | 4th Floor Meeting Room

Trung Le Nguyen: Visual Inspiration for Comics

Trung Le Nguyen (The Magic Fish) will walk you through the impact of visual research on the process of making a comic. A Q&A period will follow.

1:00 - 2:00 PM | 4th Floor Meeting Room

Ebony Flowers: Sister Images

Join headliner Ebony Flowers (Hot Comb) to stretch your creativity and create a series of drawings that will kickstart your comics brain.

2:30 - 3:30 PM | 4th Floor Meeting Room

Tillie Walden on Becoming a Cartoonist

Eisner award winning graphic novelist Tillie Walden (Spinning, Clementine, On a Sunbeam) will discuss her journey as an artist and writer, followed by a Q&A.
